channel.title: 华尔街日报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: No one in Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida’s government will attend the Beijing Olympics. But Tokyo isn’t calling it a boycott. https://t.co/BqxmTMSdNi
The expert ham sniffer of Spain smells 800 hams a day during the Christmas season. He is strained, he said, “at the limit of human possibility.” https://t.co/lMigsQHuKX
Former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey has triggered a debate among tech stalwarts over how decentralized the future internet may be https://t.co/xaF8Hpa7wZ
Anglican archbishop Desmond Tutu, who has died at age 90, led a global campaign to end South Africa’s racist policies and helped in healing the nation’s wounds https://t.co/S2OZRM0D25
An NYU grad has more than $160,000 in student loans and struggles to land a job in her field. So she sells her eggs. https://t.co/yEr33NyiSu
One hundred times as powerful as Hubble, the James Webb telescope could show the face of Abraham Lincoln on a penny from 24 miles away https://t.co/00uBHMxde2
An attack by Myanmar’s military killed dozens of people, including children, in a part of the country where resistance groups have been fighting the junta https://t.co/TwJMS26hgn
How the Taliban head-faked the world: “Monopoly of power is a story of failure,” a spokesman said—six months before the group seized Kabul and monopolized all power https://t.co/YSztGj5teT
In a city where Russia triumphed 300 years ago, Ukrainians are mobilizing to resist another Russian leader, Vladimir Putin https://t.co/NB1v459nvY
The owners of a tech incubator in Rome are resurrecting a hydropower plant designed more than 125 years ago by Albert Einstein’s father https://t.co/URV4XzqyDU
At least $100 billion has been stolen from Covid-19 relief programs designed to help individuals and businesses harmed by the pandemic, the U.S. Secret Service said https://t.co/mV4uiCOjKv
Desmond Tutu, an Anglican archbishop who led a global campaign to end South Africa’s racist policies and then helped in healing the nation’s wounds, has died at 90 https://t.co/1mUZANVsI9
Russian mercenaries have deployed to the African country of Mali, European governments said, opening a new front in a confrontation with the West https://t.co/2HB0TLf5ft
For Sian Proctor, part of the first all-civilian crew to orbit the Earth, the fear wasn't on the launchpad. The fear was that she would never get there. https://t.co/mzPakECNjB
A college a capella choir director first came up with the lyrics for “Merry Christmas Darling.” Then the Carpenters turned it into a seasonal hit. https://t.co/w6jTkE9j7I
Desmond Tutu, the Anglican archbishop who won the Nobel Peace Prize for helping to end apartheid, has died. https://t.co/6ca38JU4mo?
China is entering a new hyperpoliticized reality likely to do long-term damage to its economic performance, says China expert Barry Naughton https://t.co/nsGcgYV6dh
Where in the world is Elon Musk? Despite selling his real estate, he can be found in a colossal, waterfront Austin mansion https://t.co/IOP7JJQv2q

Latin America leads the U.S. and much of the world in vaccinations. Applying a mix of Chinese, European and American vaccines, about 62% of South America’s population has received two shots or the single dose by Johnson & Johnson. https://t.co/P7r0H2l0tZ

In his annual Christmas message, Pope Francis highlighted the social impact of the pandemic while reiterating his previous calls for equitable distribution of Covid-19 vaccines https://t.co/iTZGXSV1Vd
Director Adam McKay says he wanted “Don’t Look Up” to be a laugh-out-loud comedy. But he also notes the risks in making such movies these days. https://t.co/Zl7TC0c5zR
In the first 10 months of this year, American workers handed in nearly 39 million resignations. Bosses say rampant workplace burnout is a big problem. https://t.co/qyJ7MnHdUq
Thousands of seafarers are stuck at sea working beyond their maximum 11-month contracts, as Omicron’s emergence crimps cargo ship operators’ ability to change over crews https://t.co/5ujacnICLd
TikTok was the world’s most visited site on the internet in 2021, according to Cloudflare https://t.co/dgHzGguy1n
Why Mark Zuckerberg may be wrong about the metaverse as the inevitable next paradigm shift in the digital world https://t.co/cST95DrhPK

President Biden said he's eager to run for reelection against Donald Trump in 2024, and expressed regret that he didn’t act more quickly to distribute Covid-19 tests to the public https://t.co/Nea6jqcTjT
An unprecedented peek inside a dinosaur egg revealed a perfectly preserved oviraptor—and a surprise about the way the animals hatched https://t.co/ZZUQ4qFzBU
Elon Musk unloaded more Tesla stock on Wednesday, bringing the total value of his share sales to over $15 billion since he embarked on a selling spree last month #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/HEg82Zh9To

Latin America, once a hot spot of Covid-19 deaths, now leads much of the world in vaccinations, as health policy makers rush to shield their countries from new variants roiling other regions https://t.co/hg7jGPo1LT

Pope Francis, in his annual Christmas message, highlighted the social impact of the pandemic while reiterating his previous calls for equitable distribution of Covid-19 vaccines https://t.co/x4WzR4cz5T

Independent shops are thriving in Britain, offering hope for the global retail industry. “We can’t compete with Amazon on price,” says an independent bookseller. “But we offer something they don’t.” https://t.co/cZWn47SptB
TV actors who aren’t vaccinated against Covid-19 are seeing their characters sent on a trip—or worse https://t.co/Yx4nPwOBI6
The James Webb Space Telescope, the largest, most powerful instrument of its type ever built, launched successfully to herald a new era of space discovery https://t.co/zg9Yxor1DP
What Turkey’s currency crisis has to do with the global supply chain of Nutella https://t.co/FQQyKBEesw
The rich are borrowing against their stocks more than ever before, banks say. Taxes are a big reason for the “buy, borrow, die” strategy. https://t.co/WP7i2VqegL

The James Webb Space Telescope—the Hubble’s successor—would be the biggest and most powerful observatory ever launched into space. Here’s how it will transform our understanding of the cosmos. https://t.co/8K9VnqiYGq

Teachers fret as hundreds of books are pulled from school libraries, and the country’s largest teachers union pledges to challenge every new law that define how schools and colleges can teach subjects related to discrimination, race and gender https://t.co/Z7RAB6AQ5T
